meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo someone or something.
meanings.sent1: In the race, Sarah managed to trump all her competitors.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to trump his previous high score in the game.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel trumped the big dog in the agility contest.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to practice trumped his natural talent.
meanings.sent5: The student's hard work trumped all obstacles in her path to success.

meanings.definition: A playing card of a suit that outranks all others.
meanings.sent1: She was thrilled to have the trump card in her hand during the game.
meanings.sent2: The magician revealed the trump card to win the trick.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox used the trump card to outsmart the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Having a positive attitude can be the trump card in difficult situations.
meanings.sent5: The key information turned out to be the trump card in solving the mystery.

meanings.definition: A sound made by forcing air through closed lips.
meanings.sent1: The baby's cute trump made everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: He let out a loud trump to get his friend's attention.
meanings.sent3: The funny trump from the clown's nose made the children laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected trump interrupted the silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The trump of the trumpet filled the hall with music.
